javanews.object
Class MsgFormatter

java.lang.Object
  javanews.object.MsgFormatter

public class MsgFormatter
extends java.lang.Object

Responsible for receiving messages from the COM port (through instances of PortReader) and formatting the contents. It verifies that the contents of the message is valid and stores it within the database and displays it on-screen. If a message is not deemed to be valid then it is rejected and no further processing occurs.

Version:
1.000
Author:
Alex Harris (email: Alexander.J.Harris(at)btinternet.com)

Constructor Detail

MsgFormatter

public MsgFormatter(java.lang.String aMessage,
                    COMPortClient cpcParent)
Receives a message from a COM port, processes it and outputs the formatted result to the given COM Port Client window.

Parameters:
aMessage - The received message from the COM port
cpcParent - The parent window to which the formatted output will be sent
Method Detail

formatMessage

public void formatMessage()
Examines the contents of the string passed as a received message and checks it for problems. If there is any reasons why the string may be considered erroneous then it is thrown out. Accepted strings are broken into their constituent parts and stored in the back-end database and outputted to the screen.

Checks against the contents of the received message are performed in the following order:

  • Is the string greater than 33 characters?
  • Does the string have '(', ')' or ' '?
  • Is the first token (from the start of the string to the first space) in the format (n)?
  • Is the token for the PSE name less than or equal to 8 characters?
If any of these checks fail then the string being processed is rejected and considered to be a transmission error, error in configuration or link error.

storeDataInDb

public void storeDataInDb(java.lang.Object[] dataToStore)
Takes the provided array of objects and stores the contents in the back-end database. The array is expected to contain the following objects:
  • 0 - Severity (String)
  • 1 - PSE node name (String)
  • 2 - Link ID (String)
  • 3 - Received Error Message (String)
  • 4 - Date received from the PSE (String)
  • 5 - The universally unique identifier of the message (String)

Parameters:
dataToStore - An object array in the format mentioned above.
